title: Hipster banks Monzo and Starling win customers from high-street giants
text:
Monzo and Starling have been steadily taking current account customers from the big high street banks, new figures show.

In the last three months Monzo and Starling grew by 13,453 and 6,686 customers, according to the Current Account Switching Service (Cass).

Nationwide had the most net customers during the period, at 26,466, followed by HSBC with 15,782. Both banks have the advantages of being larger brands and routinely offer cash incentives to switch current accounts, which the newer banks do not.

Nearly 230,000 current account switches were completed between July and September this year.

Over the past year Monzo and Starling have also consistently taken on new customers, while most of their larger rivals lost them overall.
description: Monzo and Starling have been steadily taking current account customers from the big high street banks, new figures show.
